title: How to Make Strawberry Cables

steps.headline: Get out four large biscuit tins.
steps.description: Grease it with butter or greasing oil.

steps.headline: Get out a large saucepan.
steps.description: Place the sugar, syrup, half the cream, strawberry ingredient and salt in the saucepan.

steps.headline: Turn the saucepan onto a medium heat and stir thoroughly.
When the mixture starts to boil, add the remaining cream.
Let it boil for ten minutes.
At the end of this time, add the butter cubes.
Get out a thermometer.
steps.description: Place it in the mixture. Let the mixture in the saucepan boil until it reaches 250 degrees. This may take up to an hour.

steps.headline: When it reaches this temperature pour quarter of the mixture in each previously prepared tin.
Place the vanilla, sugar and shortening into a bowl and mix it with a the mixer until completely combined and creamed.
steps.description: (It will probably be very crumbly, don't worry)

steps.headline: Get out a small bowl and place the water in it.
steps.description: Place the gelatin in the water. Let it sit until the gelatin has dissolved.

steps.headline: Add the gelatin to the mixture with the mixer still going.
Keep mixing the mixture for about five minutes.
Pipe the mixture over all four of the trays evenly.
Place the trays in the fridge for an hour.
Roll the mixture up into long cables.
It is now ready to eat.

text: Get out four large biscuit tins. Grease it with butter or greasing oil. Get out a large saucepan. Place the sugar, syrup, half the cream, strawberry ingredient and salt in the saucepan. Turn the saucepan onto a medium heat and stir thoroughly.  When the mixture starts to boil, add the remaining cream. Now lower the heat. Let it boil for ten minutes.  At the end of this time, add the butter cubes.  Get out a thermometer. Place it in the mixture. Let the mixture in the saucepan boil until it reaches 250 degrees. This may take up to an hour. When it reaches this temperature pour quarter of the mixture in each previously prepared tin. Allow it to cool completely. Get out a mixer.  Place the vanilla, sugar and shortening into a bowl and mix it with a the mixer until completely combined and creamed. (It will probably be very crumbly, don't worry) Get out a small bowl and place the water in it. Place the gelatin in the water. Let it sit until the gelatin has dissolved. Add the gelatin to the mixture with the mixer still going.  Keep mixing the mixture for about five minutes.  Pipe the mixture over all four of the trays evenly.  Place the trays in the fridge for an hour.  Roll the mixture up into long cables.  It is now ready to eat.
